author: NTalx
title: Permanently "Pending Update" on pre-iOS 11 devices
content:
As others have noted, this version of the app is being incorrectly presented to devices that it no longer lists as supported.  This also means that if the app is deleted, older devices can never install the previous, still functional version from the App Store.

This is a Google-side app deployment issue. The Google Drive iOS forum has dozens of posts about this issue, and how several mass education deployments now have thousands of students each without Drive access.

It would be interesting to find out what aspect of Google Drive is so critically dependent on iOS 11 and 64-bit that the previous functional version cannot remain available to iPad 2, 3, 4 and previous iPhones.

Until then, every one of these devices with the previous version of the app installed will have a permanent pending update shown in the App Store app with a notification flag that can never be cleared.

title: DagNabbitRabbitüêáüê∞IPhone 7+ Sprint
content:
Wonderful one of the most incredibly versatile programs that one could ever ask for. 
  With Google Drive YOU have that ability to not only save and protect your images and share them if you wish, BUT....you may also save Google Sheets. Notes, and much much more. 
This program saves your metadata from your images perfectly. For those who may not be familiar with metadata, : date created, date modified, size of file, location of image, and in some apps such as ProCamera can actually show you from which compass point you were pointing the camera when said image was taken. And this actually works.  All to often whence an image is copied to a program, an app, or another device or drive this valuable metadata is lost and you simply see date created- today. Even if the image was taken 15 years ago. 
 A truly remarkable application. 
 Definitely DagNabbitRabbitüê∞ Approved

title: I‚Äôm with the ‚Äústunning feat of humanity‚Äù guy (therutabega)
content: I‚Äôm with the gentleman who wrote the ‚Äústunning feat of humanity‚Äù review (therutabega). I am a technical writer/editor, and I‚Äôve seen many word processing programs, operating systems and storage options. This is simply the best at all three. He mentioned no more thumb drives ‚Äî Remember all those contortions to remotely get past a firewall? Remember ‚Äúsyncing?‚Äù Maybe I‚Äôm just easily impressed, but I ~*still*~ marvel at how many of us walk around with a thin, pocket-sized device that serves as a: -> computer -> camera -> calendar -> gaming system -> clock -> bookshelf -> news source -> shopping mall -> high definition tv -> stereo music system ‚Äî and oh yeah, a phone! In any event, Google Drive makes it a great deal easier to access and integrate many of these functions. What will they think of next?

author: DanielJosLeary
title: Insists on installing iOS 11 version with iOS 10
content: Had to delete the Google Drive app because the App Store keeps alerting me that there is a new version to download. Except this version requires iOS 11 which I don\'t and won\'t have. This should be fine, because the App Store has the ability to see that I have iOS 10, so it skips the iOS 11 required updates after a few comfirming clicks. But this is not the case with Google Drive. It tells me the update is there, I try to download it, it tells me I only have iOS 10, so it downloads the last iOS 10 version, then the cycle starts over again. It rediculous because I\'ve re-downloaded the same iOS 10 version of the app four times before I realized what was happening. I\'m sure this is a flaw of this particular app and they way the comptible versions are listed in the app store because I have not had this problem with any other app, which has an iOS 11 only version.

author: sushichick66
title: STEVE JOBS ROLLING IN HIS GRAVE!!!
content:
Apple has lost it's vision. Google drive is no longer "compatible" with iPad 2, or my iPhone 5! This is the 2nd app that will NOT UPDATE, on my iPhone 5/iPad 2 because Apple obviously won't give older Apple hardware devices an updated iOS.

Instead of recognizing there are some of us still out there loyal to the Apple brand, we are being forced to decide to buy new Apple hardware, or another non-iOS brand. New iPhone 10, $1000+??!!! I think not, unless it can clean my house, and run errands for me?!

It's all about corporate greed for the all mighty $ my friends. Don't waste your time or money on Apple products anymore! Amazon just released a host of affordable gadgets and devices. A 32GB 10" inch Kindle Fire starts at $149 and with a micro SD card you have enough storage options to buy several tablets, before you reach the price of 1 decent iPad.

I've never used android, or any other smartphone or tablet other than Apple. I do use a PC.

I've been saving my $$ for a new 4K TV with all the cool features, the iPad, and the new iPhone 8, 8+, or 10 (X), costs as much, or more than some of the latest 65" TV's on the market right now, sans OLED technology.

What has Apple done lately? The recent keynote proved to me there is no reason, nothing truly innovative to compel me to upgrade my iPhone, or iPad for that matter.

Now that I'm losing apps on my iPhone 5 and iPad 2, I'd like to thank Apple for helping me decide. That's right, THANK YOU APPLE FOR YOUR DISLOYALTY!!

I'm going to buy a Kindle Fire or a Samsung Tablet to replace my IPad 2. And I will buy a Samsung Galaxy  8+ or Note 8 with superior displays, storage and cameras for far less $$ and superior technology. After all, it's probably made on the same assembly line as  many Apple components, and I won't have the expectation that it will last or be supported for years! Hasta la vista baby! RIP Steve!

author: CoralFreya
title: Thank you Google! üíØMaking 7th grade üé∂üôå‚ù£Ô∏è
content: My daughter is obligated by her teachers - not only to set up Google Classroom for individual classes with total parent participation) via their district supervised - assigned Google (Gmail accounts) now in middle school, she has accountability to get instructors for when/how/what she did for homework before the class starts that morning. Work parents and the particular teachers can see in real time that yes she did this or that work. Public education online- not online education just streamlined with Google Drive!  No paper need be turned in like last year. (Thank goodness)  It is amazing what is being done now- parents heard rumors since kindergarten and we all ran out and bought our 3rd and 4th graders Chrome Books - But the most awesome thing, is that I as a parent, am invited from day one this year - to keep up with her assignments via school loop/and signing up with all the referrals for Pearson success net/ Google Classroom/ various other online study guides and practice test workshops with my child's classroom teacher-provided log-in. Last year, I had to comb through her entire backpack  daily to find all the paperwork she"forgot" to give me to sign, requests for supplies due by a certain date, her Report Card I was supposed to sign that I hadn't received it the parent-teacher conference appointment I never got. What kids are learning now is what I had to go to college for and I'm a grateful single parent for every Google Classroom/Drive/Docs/Sheets/Gmail accounts made for these purposes. This is the year it all is finally coming together! 7th grade, streamlined- online homework assignments with teacher provided log-in for each student (and parent) to log into, study practice tests homework assignments submitted( without paper!)  homework is assigned done and submitted all within Google drive! Thank you God! Last year, was a nightmare - instructors attached assignments in Word format as a word document that my daughter could not convert on her Chrome Book! So if I didn't already have a PC with an active MS Office with Word, she couldn't convert it to a Google Doc to work on it at all, and If I couldn't print an assignment, my daughter had to email it to her counselor at school and show up 15 minutes early in the office to request the emailed printout of her homework assignment for her home room class!!! It been assumed, that each home not only has a personal computer and a functioning printer with ink and paper but of course, WI Fi, (not so!) I'm on permanent disability with once a month social security income. I rent a room (we share a bunkbed) for my daughter and I to live in another families home (that is considered homeless under the McKinney-Vinto education act, by the way) and yet Google makes small miracles happen when it all comes together for the greater good of our children's higher learning!  I am blessed to have an amazing 12 year old that WANTS to be her best and says she loves Science/Math (even though it's really tough she loves the challenge) AND is auditioning for lead singer in her 7th grade Choir. Dreams do come true, since kindergarten at age 5, she said "I want to be a Rock Star AND a Scientist when I grow up!" It's happening!!! I thank you, Google - everything!!! My daughter is 12 years old and learning what college kids barely got exposed to if they took the College Prep classes - like I did! üôå amazingly wonderful blessings for today's children!!!!

Avoid this app until this dev team gives the option to turn this off, if they ever do. Why can‚Äôt developers learn not to try to fix things that are not broken?

author: therutabega
title: A stunning feat of humanity
content:
Yeah, I know that\'s big praise. But seriously, look at it. This is a full productivity suite I can use hopping back and forth among my phone, work laptop, wife\'s computer, my own two office machines -- whatevah, I want to see and work on any of my stuff, I jump on the nearest device and go to work. It\'s free and it works perfectly every time. It\'s kind of insane we can do all this, actually. 

I keep expecting I\'ll miss MS Office, especially Word\'s substantially more robust feature set, because I make a lot of documentation professionally and I depended on Office for many years. But it really hasn\'t happened. I use Google docs for everything and now I really depend on the universal accessibility Drive affords. I\'m not transporting any more files on thumb drive, forget it. Life is easier, the birds are chirping. So thanks Google! I know you\'re making a mint off my small contribution to your Big Data collection. But what the heck, I wasn\'t using that anyway. And I am using this. Regards.

title: Fantastic app with one glaring iOS11 issue
content:

This is a full productivity suite I can use hopping back and forth among my phone, work laptop, wife's computer, my own two office machines -- whatevah, I want to see and work on any of my stuff, I jump on the nearest device and go to work. It's free and it works perfectly every time. It's kind of insane we can do all this, actually. 

I keep expecting I'll miss MS Office, especially Word's substantially more robust feature set, because I make a lot of documentation professionally and I depended on Office for many years. But it really hasn't happened. I use Google docs for everything and now I really depend on the universal accessibility Drive affords. I'm not transporting any more files on thumb drive, forget it. Life is easier, the birds are chirping. So thanks Google! I know you're making a mint off my small contribution to your Big Data set. But what the heck, I wasn't using that anyway. And I am using this. Regards.

author: PowerWizard
title: It was a great app but now has serious bug
content:
Updated Review: 9/22/2017
Ever since the recent update last week, Google Drive wants to capture any file attempted to be opened opened on Apple's iCloud drive and save it into Google Drive. There is no opt out available, you have to shut down the app and delete Google Drive from your iphone if you want to open an iCloud app file. This bug renders the Google Drive app basically useless. I trust Google developers are quickly trying to resolve this problem.
------
This is a great general storage app, but I have found it to be slower in overall syncing than Dropbox or MS one drive.  Google needs to take a few lessons from Dropbox and provide faster sync, provide password protection for shared links, and a few other advantages that DBx has. All need to provide better scaling price plans for needs between 1 Tb and 10 Tb. Why not have 2, 3, 4, 5 Tb plans for a single account also? Or better yet, bill users for the actual space used rather than paying for the unused maximum available storage plan? My needs scale up end down and I hate to pay for unused storage. If Google did that, I'd consolidate all other accounts to Google!
By charging users for the maximum storage ceiling rather than the storage space used, Google does not need to provide cloud storage hardware for the actual plan need, thereby selling unused the same unused storage capacity to multiple users - how fair is that! It is like a grocery store charging you for a full shopping cart when there only a few items in it a checkout :(

author: DKKeyes
title: Photo quality still downgraded
content:
Apparently no intentions to address this issue from Google. So sad. This used to be my go-to app for photo backups because it used to keep the photo quality and resolution intact without downgrading the resolution - much to my disappointment, the photo quality is fine when uploading to the drive but now photos are downgraded when you download from Google Drive back to the iPhone. This is very disappointing because it used to keep the fidelity intact. Seems like the new Google Drive app developers are riding in training wheels or cutting corners. Does nobody notice these things or does nobody care?
I won\'t be using this app until this is fixed. So disappointed with this app lately.

author: lanwarrior
title: Excel file opened in iCloud Drive is FORCED to be opened in Google Drive
content:
Prior to today\'s update (09/14/17), when I open an Excel or Word file from iCloud Drive (NOT from Google Drive), the file will be opened within iCloud Drive.

Now, when the same files are opened, Google Drive will TAKE OVER and FORCE YOU to copy the file to Google Drive.

This is a security issue because there are files that I do NOT want to copy to Google Drive. Google should NOT force user to open Excel file stored in NON-Google Drive app in Google Drive.

author: JennaLStack
title: Very Happy
content: I am very happy with this app. I\'m able to store lots of files on it. There\'s a lot of room and I have managed to get things easily organized. It is not very difficult to move files, to change their name, or to share them, which is nice. Some problems I run into include  weird temporary files taking over my folders. This is something I run into outside of the app too. Google Drive does this thing where it creates tons of temporary files when you open a file and clogs up your space. This can make things very confusing when you\'re trying to sort through files on this app. Also I accidentally deleted a bunch of pictures one time and didn\'t even realize it, so I\'m very careful when I\'m on the app not to click things. Dropbox is definitely preferred but there\'s not enough space on there for me to just use it. Drive has met all my needs without too many issues.

author: SkyLand Advisory
title: Google Drive - Epic piece of Work
content:
The greatest cloud drive ever. Does exactly as stated.

The only single thing I would change is allowing the drive to be more mobile friendly and give access to add attachments as a direct attachment or actually the format the document is in prior to it being the drive.

The only downfall to the application is the document is always part of the drive and an attachment requires people to access your drive and have permission. Very sad.

Lastly, the documents become Google formatted and can be viewed by the recipient as a Google Doc or Google Sheet.

If the Drive allowed standard attachments in original format, it would be flawless.

I am always told anything attached from the Drive can't be viewed easily or the format can't be taken in. Most things sent from my Drive are not received or viewed easily (if at all) even when permissions are given.

Finally, it does not work with sites like LinkedIn or any API based platforms. The attachments from the Drive are automatically marked as an unreadable format.

It is very, very, very sad for a company like Google to have this problem. I waited a year to write this review in hopes this was fixed, but it has not been.

author: Pomx2

Well I love google and I use Drive on a daily basis. The app is stable.
Just a minor bug:
When you open a file (from another app) in Drive, if this app isn't running in the background already then it won't work the 1st time. You'll have to come back to the other app to try again and the file when saved in Drive will be renamed as "(original filename)-1" 

Other than that I only wish it'll load video a little faster. 

Thanks to all the hard-working developers.

author: Analisem
title: Good way to share large files
content: Google Drive is my preferred way to share large numbers of high-res photos or large video files (too large to email). With the ability to limit access to particular folders within Drive, I can determine who has access to which files.  The only trouble I\'ve had is that sometimes the desktop app stops syncing for no apparent reason. Exiting and then restarting the app will resume the sync, but this shouldn\'t happen at all. I have to say that it seems to happen less with Windows 10 than it used to and it\'s not a particularly frequent occurrence anyway.  If it weren\'t for this minor issue, I\'d give it a 5-star rating.

author: Noureldin Ali
title: Great app but some bugs
content: I love this app and use it a lot but my heavy usage has made me find 2 bugs that are somewhat irritating. The first one was that I was working on a poster in Google Slides that had the dimensions of an A1 piece of paper. Opening that file on a computer worked well (except for the fact that in order to zoom in you had to actually zoom out which made the functions at the top smaller but when trying to zoom in it doesn't work) but when I tried opening it on my iPad it crashed my springboard and it took 10 seconds for me to be back on my home screen. My second issue, which I experienced on both Google Docs and Slides (Not Sheets since I don't use it really but it might be there too) is that when trying to remove files from the Recent bar at the top (even though these files were already deleted) or the Shared With Me folder, the files would not be deleted and I would have to close the app and then open it again but then even after that some files that I had deleted come back again and I have to delete them again and again. I even had an issue with the Recent bar that didn't allow me to delete 2 of the files there and I tried over 20 times (deleting them then closing the app and opening it again) and the files still don't want to go away. Now although the second issue is not a deal-breaker for me and I can still use the app with it. The first one does affect my work and even though I don't work with A1 sized pages a lot it would be nice to know that I can open the file from my iPad and edit it. (By the way I have an iPad Pro 9.7" so performance shouldn't be a problem as specs wise the A9X chip is just a tad slower than the A10 chip). Yet again I will still continue to use Google Drive/Docs/Slides/Sheets and they are much better that the Apple alternatives.

author: Greeted Urchin
title: Photo uploads now useless
content:
Update: Google finally fixed the issue from my previous review and I'm very thankful I can use it for my backups again. Without the previous issue this app is great!

Previous review:
Very dissatisfied with the last 3 updates- Google Drive used to be my "go to" to app for backing up all my iPhone photos. Sadly, I noticed with the new update there are some major flaws that didn't used to be there. First: I like using iPhone's built-in photo editing features. I use them all the time because they are versatile and they allow edits to be made to a photo without downgrading the file size/resolution. However I noticed after the latest Google Drive update that if I upload an edited photo (say I made it black and white), Google drive will upload it in its original form without the edits. This is a HUGE inconvenience for me. 
Second: it used to be the case that if I upload new photos to drive, it would maintain the title of the file as it appears on my iPhone. So before I could just upload photos any time and they would be alphabetized correctly and chronologically. Now, it uploads all iPhone photos with random titles, most of them titles "Full Size Render". What this means: if you try to upload new photos into a drive folder with pre-existing photos, you will manually have to rename any new uploads if you want your photos to be correctly alphabetized. This is time consuming and inconvenient. 
I never had these issues before.

author: 1hour19min
title: its true. no pictures
content:
Not that Im a big fan of google trying to upload every picture I ever take. I actually hate that.   But I did upload a few to share via google plus, etc.   When I visit the google drive website, these photos are quickly and clearly visible.  On this app however, all I get is a bunch of empty squares. No file name, date, preview icon, or anything.  Selecting an empty frame gives me a cryptic file name, and then attempting to "open in" or simply view the picture results in the app freezing up and doing nothing for long periods of time.   The desktop website portal is faster and better... unless you want to give google the ability to inspect every photo you ever take, and be able to use the camera in your device anytime they feel like it.
As soon as the app is installed, it sets the setting to upload every picture on the device to ON by default.  The resulting upload steals data from my plan, steals private photos, and jamms the cellular data link so I cannot do anything about it except pull the plug (airplane mode) then search for and cut off the auto upload function(s) 
 .

author: Jmtorresnj
title: Do not use this to store and share Resumes!
content: Apple has restrictions on saving files to their devices including iPhones. In order to bypass this extremely frustrating and aggravating feature, I have resorted to saving my files to google Drive. In sharing my Resume stored on Google drive I have communicated with multiple application developers with extreme frustration that they have not been able to open the resume that I sent them from Google drive. It has come to my attention that Google Drive makes it extremely difficult and nearly impossible for anyone to use any resumes sent from Google drive. This must be the exact reasonwhy I cannot get responses to resume that I sent out. I am blaming 100% my frustration of not being able to acquire employment on both Apple\'s refusal to allow users to store files to their iPhones and Google drives restriction on file sharing from their services. I refuse to allow this to continue anymore. Starting from my next device I will no longer be utilizing any Apple devices. And I will refuseto utilize to drive for any cloud service. This is required to continue any future relationship with the professional world.

author: Burst Dude!!
title: Audio File "Bug"
content:
*Update: This has since been resolved.*

My audio files will hardly play now. In order to listen, I have to have Google Drive open, with the screen turned on. If it goes to sleep, or I put the Drive app in the background, it fades off. Very disappointing for me, and a large battery killer now for my phone. This issue only occurred since the most recent update.

There's another issue I've had for a while with audio (when I could still play in background / control from iPhone home screen). If I was listening and put my phone to sleep, after turning the screen back on, if I used any of the lock screen commands (Rev 30, Play/Pause, For 30) the timecode would freeze. Then upon unlocking the phone (iPhone 6s) to control in app, pushing any button would reference the frozen time code (sometimes 10-20 minutes backward).

I love Google Drive (10/10), but I'm at 2 stars so that this is hopefully looked at for feedback. Seriously though, thanks for a great product. Hope to continue using for all things, audio included.

author: TheElement119
title: Wonderful app, but quite upset with new update
content:
Google Drive has been a wonderful app for me to store my files, especially music MP3 files. It's a great place to be able to organize songs by band names, genres, and subgenres. I loved that I could download my songs offline and listen to them in the car or wherever I went without waiting for the file to load. I have enjoyed using it and have many songs there to listen to. However, when I went on the app today, June 14th, I discovered a new update overnight. I was excited and hoped that there'd be something of interest. Instead, I found that whenever I close the app or my device goes to sleep after inactivity, the song stops and I have to keep google drive up on my screen to continue listening. This is infuriating to me. Now when I'm just doing things while listening to songs, I have to keep the app open and my device awake at all times, which is completely pointless. This will cause my battery to run down faster and I can no longer do anything while listening to music. I listen to music over 7 hours a day, and am often doing other things while listening, especially during school. Now with this app, I won't be able to listen to music while doing schoolwork since I can't leave the app and have the music continue. I am very disappointed that google has changed this, and would greatly appreciate if it were updated back to where videos can continue playing in the background. I will give 5 stars if this is changed, as I have loved this app, but since now it's going to be quite difficult to listen to my music ever, I have to give it 1 star. I will continue to deal with the app at this time as it will take hundreds of hours for me to get all my songs again in a different place, but you have just made a pointless decision to make videos unable to play in the device background. This is all I wanted to say. Please change this. I can't say I'd recommend this to anyone since I just have wasted hundreds of hours on getting music files on an app that at the decision of the company, has just made it a pain to even bother with. Put your music somewhere else if you're considering this app unless google changes this. With the state the Google Drive is in now with this change, I'll have to tell everyone I've recommended this app to to not bother with it.

EDIT: I see google has fixed this change with their latest update. Very happy with this. Will give the app 5 stars again as it is a great app to use to place MP3 files.

author: TheElement119
title: Wonderful app, but quite upset with new update
content: Google Drive has been a wonderful app for me to store my files, especially music MP3 files. It's a great place to be able to organize songs by band names, genres, and subgenres. I loved that I could download my songs offline and listen to them in the car or wherever I went without waiting for the file to load. I have enjoyed using it and have many songs there to listen to. However, when I went on the app today, June 14th, I discovered a new update overnight. I was excited and hoped that there'd be something of interest. Instead, I found that whenever I close the app or my device goes to sleep after inactivity, the song stops and I have to keep google drive up on my screen to continue listening. This is infuriating to me. Now when I'm just doing things while listening to songs, I have to keep the app open and my device awake at all times, which is completely pointless. This will cause my battery to run down faster and I can no longer do anything while listening to music. I listen to music over 7 hours a day, and am often doing other things while listening, especially during school. Now with this app, I won't be able to listen to music while doing schoolwork since I can't leave the app and have the music continue. I am very disappointed that google has changed this, and would greatly appreciate if it were updated back to where videos can continue playing in the background. I will give 5 stars if this is changed, as I have loved this app, but since now it's going to be quite difficult to listen to my music ever, I have to give it 1 star. I will continue to deal with the app at this time as it will take hundreds of hours for me to get all my songs again in a different place, but you have just made a pointless decision to make videos unable to play in the device background. This is all I wanted to say. Please change this. I can't say I'd recommend this to anyone since I just have wasted hundreds of hours on getting music files on an app that at the decision of the company, has just made it a pain to even bother with. Put your music somewhere else if you're considering this app unless google changes this. With the state the Google Drive is in now with this change, I'll have to tell everyone I've recommended this app to to not bother with it.

author: Burst Dude!!
title: Audio File "Bug"
content:
My audio files will hardly play now. In order to listen, I have to have Google Drive open, with the screen turned on. If it goes to sleep, or I put the Drive app in the background, it fades off. Very disappointing for me, and a large battery killer now for my phone. This issue only occurred since the most recent update.

There's another issue I've had for a while with audio (when I could still play in background / control from iPhone home screen). If I was listening and put my phone to sleep, after turning the screen back on, if I used any of the lock screen commands (Rev 30, Play/Pause, For 30) the timecode would freeze. Then upon unlocking the phone (iPhone 6s) to control in app, pushing any button would reference the frozen time code (sometimes 10-20 minutes backward).

I love Google Drive (10/10), but I'm at 2 stars so that this is hopefully looked at for feedback. Seriously though, thanks for a great product. Hope to continue using for all things, audio included.

author: Greeted Urchin
title: Photo uploads now useless
content:
Google Drive used to be my \"go to\" to backup all my iPhone photos. Sadly, I noticed with the new update there are some major flaws that didn\'t used to be there. First: I like using iPhone\'s built-in photo editing features. I use them all the time because they are versatile and they allow edits to be made to a photo without downgrading the file size/resolution. However I noticed after the latest Google Drive update that if I upload an edited photo (say I made it black and white), Google drive will upload it in its original form without the edits. This is a HUGE inconvenience for me. 
Second: it used to be the case that if I upload new photos to drive, it would maintain the title of the file as it appears on my iPhone. So before I could just upload photos any time and they would be alphabetized correctly and chronologically. Now, it uploads all iPhone photos with random titles, most of them titles \"Full Size Render\". What this means: if you try to upload new photos into a drive folder with pre-existing photos, you will manually have to rename any new uploads if you want your photos to be correctly alphabetized. This is time consuming and inconvenient. 
I never had these issues before. Very disappointed with the new Drive version. I hope they fix this

author: darmok
title: Second only to Quip
content:
Pros
‚Ä¢ Nearest cloud based competitor in quality to MS Office and iWork
‚Ä¢ More reliable cloud access than iWork
‚Ä¢ NEW - Notifications of any changes. This is in addition to file comments

Cons
‚Ä¢ Designed around composing documents instead of collaboration, contrast w Quip where conversation is easy to see and central to user experience.

The once king of collaboration fell seriously behind Quip, but has made a strong comeback. Every download of those alternatives should be considered a vote against managers who stifled internal google efforts to innovate along those lines. To the credit of the new collaborative improvements at Google Drive you can request updates for any doc you want to monitor closely , but it is not the default, so you don\'t have an Updates stream like that feature in Quip.

author: PowerWizard
title: Great App, but slower sync than the other competitors
content:
This is a great general storage app, but I have found it to be slower in overall syncing than Dropbox or MS one drive.  Google needs to take a few lessons from Dropbox and provide faster sync, provide password protection for shared links, and a few other advantages that DBx has. All need to provide better scaling price plans for needs between 1 Tb and 10 Tb. Why not have 2, 3, 4, 5 Tb plans for a single account also? Or better yet, bill users for the actual space used rather than paying for the unused maximum available storage plan? My needs scale up end down and I hate to pay for unused storage. If Google did that, I'd consolidate all other accounts to Google!
By charging users for the maximum storage ceiling rather than the storage space used, Google does not need to provide cloud storage hardware for the actual plan need, thereby selling unused the same unused storage capacity to multiple users - how fair is that! It is like a grocery store charging you for a full shopping cart when there only a few items in it a checkout :(

author: donllively
title: OK ... for basic cloud storage, access
content:
I am not a fan of The Cloud. I just do not trust my stuff on someone else's server. There is no need for me to be apologetic here; my stuff, my decision.
I use GoogeDrive as a trailer-rig for regularly accessed files I don't feel like toying with iTune's sillinesses to accomplish the same thing: files I want to use while ambulatory quickly and as easily as I use them on a MS opsys-based desktop personal computer at home. I simply want to copy files I plan to use for a week to my mobile device, so I don't have to mix it with the files sitting on my device.
GD allows that. It is quick and dirty. Copy the files to the GD directory on my desktop, within moments I am able to leave my abode and use the files.
5 Stars for that easiness.
I do not know the ins-&-outs of the GD app but I am not a fan of its resident audio player, and it seems to have a problem finding, thus using by default, the audio player I installed on my iPh6s+. Because its resident tool for using the audio files sitting within the app cannot find and thus use a very popular audio player I am subtracting 2 stars. When that gets fixed I'll modify my review
Thank you.

author: Greeted Urchin
title: Very disappointed with newest version
content:
Google Drive used to be my "go to" to backup all my iPhone photos. Sadly, I noticed with the new update there are some major flaws that didn't used to be there. First: I like using iPhone's built-in photo editing features. I use them all the time because they are versatile and they allow edits to be made to a photo without downgrading the file size/resolution. However I noticed after the latest Google Drive update that if I upload an edited photo (say I made it black and white), Google drive will upload it in its original form without the edits. This is a HUGE inconvenience for me. 
Second: it used to be the case that if I upload new photos to drive, it would maintain the title of the file as it appears on my iPhone. So before I could just upload photos any time and they would be alphabetized correctly and chronologically. Now, it uploads all iPhone photos with random titles, most of them titles "Full Size Render". What this means: if you try to upload new photos into a drive folder with pre-existing photos, you will manually have to rename any new uploads if you want your photos to be correctly alphabetized. This is time consuming and inconvenient. 
I never had these issues before. Very disappointed with the new Drive version. I hope they fix this so I can go back to rating it 5 stars.

author: KingOfSalsa
title: handy app for iPad, but I have issues with it.
content:
It is easy to use, having an fairly intuitive interface.
I have pics automatically backed up, and then 
later I rename and move them to other directories
to organize by content, date, type, or etc. 

I get use of it for free, which helps me like it more. 

On the other hand...
I have lost HUNDREDS of files at a time using it, 
because files didn't sync properly before my laptop 
automatically did an update? I spent 2 hours on phone 
without of  their tech support persons, but 
we couldn't find the lost files! They were important but 
not vital files, else I would have gone from it! 

BE CAREFUL TO SYNC OFTEN if uploading or modifying
more than a couple files.

Another down-side is that associated apps (such as Google Docs) are huge!  Because of team-sharing?  Other than that, it's just a text editor (talking about Google Docs).  

Also seems odd (or overly possessive) that if a file created w another text editor is edited by GoogleDrive/GoogleDocs combo, it changes the file type and retains sole ownership of it.  
How come it can't just save the file in the same/existing type and not retain ownership of it?  

I would like to have BATCH operations, like
to rename multiple files and/or move them 
to a directory where I keep similar items. 

I also would like to see the file size. 
I know Google compresses them, but how
about an original and compressed size?
I will compress big pics so that I can get more 
in my allocated disk space, but right now
I don't know how to determine which to compress--like by making them lower-resolution and/or cropping.

title: Fantastic cross-platform storage!
content:
As a user of multiple devices across multiple operating systems (Mac, iOS, Windows 7, Windows 10, Windows Mobile 10), Drive is an irreplaceable necessity!  All my documents are synchronized on all my devices* and Google provides plentiful free storage. 

*iOS - when trying to open Excel/Word/PowerPoint type documents, you must have the equivalent Google app (Sheets/Docs, etc.) and I've learned you must mark each document as Available Offline - otherwise a blank document opens. Otherwise, seamless synchronization and access are outstanding.

author: monc_prov
title: Using Google Drive is a no-brainer for anyone who has "lost"stuff on their various gadgets.
content: Or cannot remember if it is on the PC, phone or ipad or whatever gadget one uses. Portable, accessible from anywhere (granted- you do need wifi connectivity) and easy to shift to anytime. It took me a while to use Drive for all my 'saves' but now I do and breathe a sigh of relief every time my aging PC fails to start up yet again. I now ignore the fear that big brother (in its Google incarnation) is looking into my stuff. My stuff isn't that important except to me. I do use two backup hard drives too just in case Google's servers decide to croak. Only thing to be careful of if you are a new user is that you must refresh (if your device needs that) to see what you have just done so that Drive syncs right away.

author: IP_Atl
title: Awesome! All your files on-the-go all the time!
content: My wife and I use this to manage our lives, lol. We use this for bills, home owner insurance/car insurance documents, home remodeling ideas, invoices for home and car repairs, vacation itineraries, new vacation ideas etc.....on and on. This helps us organize our life and we both have access to the folders and if either of us makes edits the other is always looped in. It's increased our communication 10 fold, we're always on the same page now.

author: Bimmerman2002
title: Legacy Support
content:
No joke at this moment, my newest apple device is a iPod Touch 4th gen. Its maxed out on 6.1.6 and guess what, Google Drive no longer syncs so I had to troubleshoot. First I tried letting it sit for a few hours. It was hanging and refused to sync any files. I tried updating it to the latest version 2.2.3 (iOS 6 supported) No luck. Then it was a try to delete the app and restore via my backup. Still no luck. I tried downgrading to the last supported iOS 5 version 1.5.0. Nope still refuses to sync.  Ironically, my computer syncs fine. 

I'm lost at all words because like I said my iPod is my newest apple device and, I don't have money (and won't for the next few years) for a new one. I try to get support and its like a gigantic middle finger in my face. 

Fortunetly, I have other apps I can use but man, why do you have to abandon support for someone who cannot afford the newest iPhone or iPod

author: g916543
title: Decent, Useful, & Free
content:
In principal, Google drive is my favorite file storage app. It's really easy to use the single Google login and give access to other Google users. The OS universality makes it really convenient.

The amount of free storage they give you is ample, and their uptime is good.

They need to improve the app for iOS though. It seems to be CPU/mem intensive, it seems to temporarily hang, and if I click away or the screen locks during an upload it fails. The throttling for up/downloads is also a bit much.

There aren't really any better options. But, it's Google, and you know they could do better. Good enough, isn't good enough.

Don\'t even get me started on calendars. I run a family of 6 with a job that takes me out of the city often if not more, a husband who has a crazy work schedule and a teenager, no comment there. Everyone gets to be where they need to be thanks to Google Calendar. There isn\'t a more efficient calendar to use for families. I even share with the grandparents for they can\'t attend sports event or recitals.

author: HeadMoose
title: Works Very Well
content:
Ok - a year later and this is still very, very good - possibly the best for both iOS and Windows.
Fast and reliable - and additional storage space is both flexible and reasonably priced. This is really an essential!
-----------------------------------
This app is very well integrated across platforms and other Google apps!
It is solid, dependable, and as private as any cloud storage (i.e., not very). You should consider a third-party encryption program for any sensitive data you store here.
Unlike iCloud, GDrive allows full access to all files on your cloud drive, making file mgmt possible and very easy. Apple should take a lesson here!

EASY to save files to specific folders, create a class folder n share the folder with students so they can access documents, calendars, assignments, etc. 

Or, create a Standards or Scope N Sequence Folder and collaborate within department, on-line and minimize in-person meetings.

Easy to \"drop\" files in Google Drive from phone, email, Internet, etc as well as keeping it all organized.

 EASY MULTI-DEVICE ACCESS from ANYWHERE with internet.

Easy to share a file from the convenience of your phone. No need to \"try to remember\". Get things done right when you think of it, minimizing the \"I forgots\" and Post-its 

Definitely happy about using Google Drive üòä

It\'s ridiculously time consuming   Now I cannot view any files that were made \"available offline\"   Either way I don\'t understand why a photo that I took would require \"online availability\" to view a photo taken from my phone. author: Jak Hudjak
title: Best multi-editor app!
content:
Hands down the best app for synchronized, multi-editing. I use Google Drive to manage all types of documents for both of my jobs and home life. Google Drive gives me the ability to edit spreadsheets and other important docs with my business partner ( from the opposite side of the world) in real time, save all of that information in the cloud (in organized folders), and I can save anything I need to my phone or tablet for easy access on the go. 

I use the drive at home to keep up with important household docs. Being able to access certain paperwork when away from the house has saved me lots of time.

Having so much information centrally located and being able to access it all from anyway is amazing! 

And you get it all with your FREE email account! Who else is providing this type of service?

I haven\'t even touched on G-Suites.  If you\'re  a small business owner and you\'re not using this Google product, then you\'re either paying someone else too much or your loosing out on an unmatched opportunity.

author: Brit0217
title: Don\'t sleep on it!!!
content:
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE don\'t sleep on Google Drive! 
It was a sad and treacherous day in February of 2016 that brought me to use Google Drive full-time! On this day, my flash drive CRASHED and alll my glorious work died with it! I didn\'t give up hope, paying $30 for a tech analyst to tell me what I already knew, \"Sorry ma\'am, this jumpdrive is down for the count and there\'s nothing I can do to get all your 4-5 gbs of info back!\"

So, I decided to go with a more suitable and safe way to store all my work and Google Drive was the most reasonable option!! The program is amazing and the app is even more magnificent! As the title of this review indicates... PLEASE DON\'T SLEEP ON THIS APP! Download it now!

author: turtle8271
title: Google UX intentionally skews App Store ratings
content:
Instead of simply asking users whether they want to rate & review the app (or, of course, doing nothing at all), Google has added an interstitial dialog box. It prompts users whether they like the app or not, then sends positive feedback to the App Store and redirects negative feedback to Google, where it goes to die.

As a result of this intentionally disingenuous UI, the ratings here are skewed higher than users\' actual experiences.

content: I spent three aggravating years running my small business without Google Drive. Life is SO much better now! Emailing and sharing docs with clients is now a breeze and all my files are neatly organized and securely backed up. Gmail, Google Drive and Google Voice are a winning combination for me!!

author: LifeTC
title: Google Gold
content: Simply awesome! Easy to use, good file sharing, quick uploads and downloads, very easy organizing files, and I love the associated google apps. Google sheets has some compatibility issues with formulas in excel spreadsheets. The formulas do not work when an excel file is opened using google sheets. Cloud print is cool, but sometimes i  loose connection with the printer even when the status shown is \'connected\'. When using google docs or google sheets after selecting the print function the dialog box does not list the printers. When I select the \'change device\' button the cloud ready connected printers do not show up. Sometime the print function works and other times it doesn\'t, it\'s frustrating sometimes. Overall, google drive is awesome!

title: Great, but new flaw
content: The latest update has file preview tiles for recently accessed files. The problem: the tiles show images of the file contents and launch them even if the files are in password protected folders. Big flaw!

author: DewbackRider
title: Best Cloud Drive
content: Google Drive is useful. You can store so much. It partners well with other apps for editing and printing. It\'s not subpar to the desktop version. I use it for work, school, and personal projects. It\'s been incredibly useful for collaboration.

author: Jcessenwein
title: Never see a \"Cloud is full\" message again
content: Google Drive is Microsoft Office on the go without worrying about having an external hard drive.  It\'s easy to share your files with anyone--even if they don\'t use Google Drive. You can convert Docs to Word files or PDFs very easily and make anything available offline. And you can update your files anywhere. It\'s easier for me to stay organized by being able to access my files in the same place on any device. Plus, they\'re always password protected. AND (here\'s the big one) I have never run out of cloud space. And I use Google Drive for everything from work to grocery lists, so I have a lot saved to my drive.

author: ricshaw910
title: Makes life easier
content: Ever since I started using Drive, I\'ve found multiple ways of making my life easier in general by using it. From storing saved PDFs, to keeping track of my progress in the gym, to sharing wedding documents with my wife that we are constantly updating on different computers - this app is fantastic and reliable.

It\'s one of the best places to safely store information, and to make Google Documents, Google Slides, Google Charts, and Google Surveys. It\'s a brilliant tool a d I\'m sure it will not let you down.

title: Professional Grade

On every level, the products continue to improve in their utility and ease-of-use across all platforms. It is obvious that the Google Drive team is getting the full support of their parent company, Alphabet.

author: HybridxReality
title: Don\'t upload over 50 picture at once.
content: The service and prices are great and it\'s generally easy to upload pictures. However I began to notice some pictures I thought I had uploaded were missing. I normally upload pictures in large groups of sometimes over 100 at once and I noticed today of a set of photos that were missing. I decide to do some tests to see if my suspicions were correct - and they were. When I uploaded 50, everything was fine. I tried 100 and around 30 were missing. Very bothered at how many old pictures I thought were saved to the cloud are gone now and I\'ve just now realized it. Stay safe and upload regularly. Stay under 50 pictures at a time.

title: File Provider extension is buggy.
content:
The File Provider extension support is incredibly buggy. Cannot open a file from another app, make edits, and have document saved back to original location.

Trying to move documents from another app to Drive via File Provider extension is also buggy.. never finishes upload, multiple copies created.

Please fix the bugs in your use of the File Provider and Document Provider ios extensions.

author: UbeRamza
title: Google Drive is a great app. Love it.
content:
I\'ve been using Google Drive for a couple years now and I love it. It works great and it\'s very user friendly. I\'ve never had any issues or problems with it.  I\'ve tried other cloud services and I always come right back.  It\'s very easy to use and even accessible to those of us that aren\'t as tech minded as others. 
My wife was looking for an easier, more user friendly way of moving her photos from her iPhone and iPad to her laptop instead of using iTunes (which is horrible and needs to be completely overhauled IMO). So I told her about Google Drive and set it up on all of her devices. After trying it out she likes it a lot and it\'s the only method she uses for moving her photos now.

author: Yogi Ev
title: Drive beats them all
content: I don\'t know how I would live without Drive. Sounds a bit dramatic I understand. Sure, I could survive, but what quality of life could there be without Drive\'s  seamless integration with gmail and my other most used apps, and ease of use for sharing and storage. I use Dropbox and iCloud too, S3 too come to think of it, but none of those give me the joy I get from Drive. I especially like not having to launch another app to view a doc, watch a video or listen to an mp3. When sharing files like videos, music and documents on gmail you can view them right in the window with the email, without having to download it first. Bored yet? I could go on.... Get Drive you will soon wonder how you ever lived without it.

author: JennaLStack
title: Very Happy
content: I am very happy with this app. I\'m able to store lots of files on it. There\'s a lot of room and I have managed to get things easily organized. It is not very difficult to move files, to change their name, or to share them, which is nice. Some problems I run into include  weird temporary files taking over my folders. This is something I run into outside of the app too. Google Drive does this thing where it creates tons of temporary files when you open a file and clogs up your space. This can make things very confusing when you\'re trying to sort through files on this app. Also I accidentally deleted a bunch of pictures one time and didn\'t even realize it, so I\'m very careful when I\'m on the app not to click things. Dropbox is definitely preferred but there\'s not enough space on there for me to just use it. Drive has met all my needs without too many issues.

author: iSaro
title: Perfection!
content: After trying Apples $2.99 per month, 200GB cloud storage service I was told, and found out for myself, that viewing videos and pics stored in iCloud would count against the storage on my iPhone. In other words, a 52GB photo/video library would need AT LEAST a 52GB phone. Ridiculous. I have a 32GB phone. Switched to Google Drive and uploaded my entire library. Viewable on all devices and does NOT count against the storage on my phone.  Google, you did it right. $1.99 per month gets you 100GB and there\'s a discount if you pay for the entire year.  Am I slowly becoming a non-Apple person?

Store them in Google Drive and delete the pics from your camera roll to free up some space! You can also make files (Microsoft office files, pics, even music) can be made to be available offline so you don\'t even need an internet connection to view, make changes to docs or edit pics or listen to music anywhere you are. author: Jeremiah256
title: The Best Cloud Storage
content:
OneDrive, Box, iCloud, Dropbox, and Google Drive.  I\'ve used them all, but keep coming back to Google Drive.  

1-Flexible.  Google allows you to easily have multiple accounts.  I have an account for professional documents, another for school, another for personal files.  

2-Security.  Two-factor authentication, by text, phone call, or Authenticator app. 

3-Power. Google Drive is connected to Google Docs.  Ability to convert uploaded files to different formats is incredibly valuable.

author: Agc3218
title: Google Drive is such a blessing!
content:
I can easily share pictures, music, articles etc. with my brother who lives across the world in Italy. 

It makes group projects at school 100x more efficient because everyone has access to the work so people can work on it more than just the 2 times a week they have class together. 

It has also allowed me to organize my drive with folders. This has made a huge difference in my life and getting things done. 

I am so grateful for companies like google who actually focus on how they can best help people. Some companies allow greed to corrupt them, and solely offer products to make money. Google on the other hand is constantly doing things to make everyone\'s lives better!

author: Bear@Large
title: Transparent, easy to use, good enough for legacies!
content: I\'m 70, living with terminal cancer, and have used Drive extensively in my personal and business life.  I\'m more comfortable with reposing my life data with Google because Apple\'s steroid-driven marketing and data-gathering make me skeptical of long-term availability.  Corpses sell no meta-data.  In business, it seems easier to impose restrictions on file sharing on Drive than on Apples multiple storage ports and devices.  Microsoft is late in the game and has good reason these days to maintain its image of ruthlessness and optimal profit.

title: Poor implementation
content:

I would vastly prefer using the web-based version in my iPad Pro, but of course Chrome doesn\'t allow you to do so from iOS. You\'re pretty much stuck with these apps. If you have a full PC or Mac handy, don\'t bother with these apps.

author: Hike_it
title: Essential
content: I\'ve been using Google Drive, Docs, and Slides for two years now, and I\'ve never been more organized and on top of my work. I\'ve been a teacher for five years and this has been the first year that I have heavily relied on the \"share\" capabilities of Docs. It has changed the way I approach my classroom and assignments, projects, and assessments. I have moved away, as much as possible, from relying on paper and packets and three-ring binders in my classes, and my students are now more organized than they have ever been. I\'m a huge fan of Google!

title: Sorta creepy but otherwise I love it
content:
I find cloud storage (& orgs that collect every scrap of your personal data) be a bit creepy, but I guess it is the way of things. 

I love drive. It is free at the low end and quite capable. 

That said, loading a word doc into drive, editing (especially, but not only, with track changes so someone else can \"accept\" each edit individually turned on), and handing back to ms word is improving, but still not quite there yet. I 80% blame protectionist/monopolist Microsoft, but still -- it is (for now) the standard which all must work around/with.

title: Great app that crashes
content:
Google Drive is a great, simple and fast app for cloud storage. It has many things going for it, and generous Google let\'s you have 15GB worth of storage for free as a gmail user. Microsoft OneDrive, which I also have and like, took away 25GB of free storage they gave use Outlook users, and now we have 5GB. Very nice üò°. Google Drive is faster, but I like the \"look\" of OneDrive better as your folders feature a photo that is within the folder as it\'s dashboard identity. 
The only issue I\'m having with the app is that it constantly crashes when sending files to the trash, and that = four stars. I\'m running the latest iOS and the latest app version. Google, you might check on that. üòâ

author: Moshamo
title: Very powerful, tons of room for improvement
content:
We run a small business with the drive.  This app allows good use and access from devices. For IOS products, There are two areas that need immediate improvement.  The ability to annotate and amend .pdfs right from the drive is critical.   All of the apps out there that allow this, but require syncing are buggy, and cumbersome.  Consider that they all have different functionality and your device becomes Byzantine web of patched together tools that do this, but not that.  Just let us markup and sign a .pdf right from this and you\'ve triple the functionality of it.  Add in Apple Pencil and you\'d really have something.

Great job.  We love google drive.  This app can be so much better...  Hope to see these things soon!!

author: PositiveTrends
title: A ways to go, but...
content: I have enjoyed using Google Drive at no cost since its inception and have always been appreciative of the use of its software and storage.  Almost as user friendly and intuitive as Apple products in terms of practicality. I have not found that the word processing or office app facilities are able to function as well as MS Word and hence still use the others when I can.  For a \"free\" service you simply cannot complain.  I am now running over my 15GB of free storage and am having to bite the bullet and pay for service. Still, $1.99 monthly is not too high a price to pay for a TB of storage.  What bothers me the most is that there is no way to pay for this on an annual or even multi-year basis. Instead we are required to go monthly - and with automatic debit.  I find that very similar to the \"closed system\" that is Apple and something that I had hoped Google would differentiate itself from.  To say I am disappointed would be an understatement. I hope that Google will reconsider this policy and provide multiple ways to pay for the service when the time comes.

author: GWErskine
title: Great except....
content:
I love the ability to easily access my documents and storage from any of the platforms I use at any time. 
I do not like it\'s lack of a robust method of moving things to and from my drives.  

The extension to do this in Windows 10 is spotty and has major problems for my systems.

It keeps disappearing and doesn\'t always install properly. 

Right now it won\'t install on my PC.  

After I tell it to install the extension, it appears to install.  But then it keeps telling me to install it. Which I do but the cycle of attempted installation continues 

I would still recommend this product.  I have used it for years along with Google Docs  and spreadsheets.

The problem is that it won\'t allow you to use the mini keepass app to open your encrypted database file.  There used to be a workaround where you could log into Google Drive in safari, but now the Google Drive site won\'t allow you to log in if you\'re accessing it from a mobile browser like Safari, so it\'s a total no go.  I switched to Dropbox on this and all my other devices for hosting.

author: racerhomie
title: Google Drive and iCloud Drive are not for Privacy.
content: The Products ,google drive and iCloud Drive ,are great products for the Cloud Age,but Remember,they are not built for Privacy,specially GDrive.Google looks through your data and sells them to advertisers,and the NSA can easily use the data.Meanwhile ,iCloud ,I believe is a safer choice.Apple does not sale your Data,NSA might still have access,but encryption at least ensures local hackers do not access your data.Some might argue 5 vs 15GB ,but only 99c gives you 50GB.But For people who value privacy get a 4TB Hard drive and store docs,photos over there.Storage is quite cheap nowadays,please do not sale your Data to Google for only $12.(The value of your data to them).

title: Google drive rocks for file storage
content: I\'ve been using google drive for my file storage for quite some time.  Now mat of the time the free version would be plenty of space for the average user, however, I have massive files that I need to be certain are safe.  These are embroidery designs that I\'ve many times purchased, so you can understand why it is so important that they are safe from corruption and loss.  I simply upload them to google drive and they are safe.  I pay a nominal fee for 100 gigabytes which so far has been plenty.  I\'m only at about 40.  I am so happy I do not have to worry about my expensive files being lost.  You won\'t be sorry using google drive.

author: GravityHorse
title: Probably my favorite app
content:
Google Drive is outstanding. I write music and store the exported files in Drive so I can play them anywhere. It\'s great for keeping music with you anywhere without adds or paying a premium for a streaming service, and keeping all important files together through Windows, Mac, iPhone, etc. 

My biggest criticism/request: Drive does not have a playlist for music. Tracks can only be played one at a time, and cannot be repeated without input. 

Google, I know this isn\'t a music app, but PLEASE implement a simple playlist for music playback. Highlight multiple tracks, then play them one at a time. Repeat and shuffle would be a bonus! 

I\'m on an iPhone 6s Plus. : )

author: dj jon bates
title: An essential product moves closer to perfection
content:
The original gDrive was a breakthrough cloud experience that offered a limited, smart set of features that made our jobs easier, simpler and more productive.

The relatively static period over a couple years where Drive and Google Apps were tweaked but not enhanced ended last year, and each release since has showered new features, improved UX and visual elegance throughout... while following Rule #1 of Product Dev: Don\'t Break The Basics.

(Any early Photoshop user will agree that its recent iterations are Rule #1 felonies.)
Well done, GOOG.
